revised_title: Comparative Water-Conductivity in Evergreen Trees and Shrubs
tldr: The author investigates the water-conductivity of wood in evergreen trees and shrubs, measuring the amount of water passing through a given length of twig at standard pressure. The study aims to determine if the efficiency of wood as a water-conducting tissue can be quantified and if there is a correlation between water-conductivity and plant characteristics such as deciduous or evergreen habits.
